findings.title: Unprotected Implementation Contract
findings.description: Consider adding a constructor with `initialize()` to avoid initialization of the implementation contract by anyone.

findings.title: Unused Import of ERC2981Upgradeable
findings.description: The `ERC2981Upgradeable` import is not used in the DropCollection contract.

findings.title: Unused `MerkleProofUpgradeable` Using-Declaration
findings.description: The `MerkleProofUpgradeable` using-declaration is not used in the DropCollection contract.

findings.title: Incorrect Revert Message in onlyMintable() Modifier
findings.description: The `onlyMintable()` modifier has an incorrect revert message, it should be something like 'Must be greater than 0' or 'Quantity is 0'.

findings.title: Unnecessary Variable Reads
findings.description: In the `presaleMint()` function, the `_mintCount[_msgSender()]` variable is read multiple times.

findings.title: Missing Error Message in Array Length Validation
findings.description: In the `batchAirdrop()` function, arrays length validation is performed without an error message.

findings.title: No Checks for Mint Amount
findings.description: In the `batchAirdrop()` function, no checks are performed for mint amount.

findings.title: Unnecessary Validation
findings.description: The `quantity > 0` validation is performed twice in the `_purchaseMint()` function.

findings.title: Incorrect Revert Message
findings.description: The `_purchaseMint()` function quantity validation revert message is incorrect

findings.title: Unprotected Implementation Contract
findings.description: Consider adding a constructor with `initialize()` to avoid initialization of the implementation contract by anyone.

findings.title: Unused Import of ERC2981Upgradeable
findings.description: The `ERC2981Upgradeable` import is not used in TokenCollection contract.

findings.title: Unnecessary Double Call of redeemableAt() Function
findings.description: In the `redeem()` function, the `redeemableAt(redeemableId)` is called twice, which can lead to unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: Unnecessary Storage Reads
findings.description: In the withdraw() function of BaseCollection, the `_niftyKit` variable is read from storage three times, which can lead to unnecessary gas usage.

findings.title: Consecutive Calls to `_niftyKit` Optimization
findings.description: In the `withdraw()` function, combining two consecutive calls to `_niftyKit` contract into one can save gas.

findings.title: Unprotected Implementation Contract Initialization
findings.description: Consider adding a constructor with `initialize()` to avoid initialization of the implementation contract by anyone.

findings.title: Potential Failure of `_dropKitPass.getFeeRateOf()` due to Excessive Tokens
findings.description: In the `_createCollection()` function, if `msg.sender` has too many tokens (too many entries in `dropKitPass` contract), then `_dropKitPass.getFeeRateOf()` will fail because gas needed for the 'for' loop can exceed the block gas limit, causing collection creation to fail for that user.

findings.title: Unused `MerkleProofUpgradeable` Using-Declaration
findings.description: The `MerkleProofUpgradeable` using-declaration is not used.

findings.title: Redundant Storage Reads in `_redeem()` Function
findings.description: The `redeemableAt(redeemableId)` function is called twice in the second `_redeem()` function, resulting in redundant storage reads.

findings.title: Unnecessary Double Call of `redeemableAt` Function
findings.description: In the `redeem()` function, the `redeemableAt(redeemableId)` is called twice, resulting in unnecessary storage reads.

findings.title: Unnecessary Storage Read Optimization
findings.description: In the `_redeem()` function, the `_redeemedByWallet[redeemableId][_msgSender()]` variable is read from storage twice, causing unnecessary gas consumption.
